title: Prohibits the sale of salvia divinorum to persons in New York state
summary: Prohibits the sale of salvia divinorum to persons in New York state; defines salvia divinorum; sets penalties for sale and provides a defense.

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 18, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  HEASTIE  --  Multi-Sponsored  by -- M. of A.
         BOYLAND, CYMBROWITZ, DINOWITZ, LIFTON, PEOPLES-STOKES, PHEFFER, ROBIN-
         SON, ZEBROWSKI -- read once and referred to the Committee on Codes

       AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to prohibiting the possession
         of salvia divinorum by persons in New York state

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  penal  law is amended by adding a new article 222 to
    2  read as follows:
    3                                 ARTICLE 222
    4                       POSSESSION OF SALVIA DIVINORUM
    5  SECTION 222.00 POSSESSION OF SALVIA DIVINORUM.
    6  S 222.00 POSSESSION OF SALVIA DIVINORUM.
    7    1. NO PERSON, FIRM,  CORPORATION,  PARTNERSHIP,  ASSOCIATION,  LIMITED
    8  LIABILITY  COMPANY,  OR  OTHER  ENTITY  SHALL  POSSESS SALVIA DIVINORUM,
    9  COMMONLY KNOWN AS SALVIA WITHIN NEW YORK STATE, EXCEPT AS AUTHORIZED  BY
   10  SUBDIVISION THREE OF THIS SECTION.
   11    2.  FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, THE TERM SALVIA DIVINORUM SHALL MEAN
   12  THE HERB FREQUENTLY REFERRED TO AS "SKA MARIA  PASTORA"  AND  "DIVINER'S
   13  SAGE" WHICH IS A PERENNIAL HERB IN THE MINT FAMILY THAT RESEMBLES SAGE.
   14    3.   NOTHING   IN   THIS   SECTION   SHALL  APPLY  TO  NONPRESCRIPTION
   15  OVER-THE-COUNTER DRUGS APPROVED OR REGULATED BY  THE  FEDERAL  FOOD  AND
   16  DRUG ADMINISTRATION.
   17    4.  ANY  PERSON,  FIRM, CORPORATION, PARTNERSHIP, ASSOCIATION, LIMITED
   18  LIABILITY COMPANY, OR OTHER ENTITY THAT VIOLATES THE PROVISIONS OF  THIS
   19  SECTION  BY POSSESSING SALVIA DIVINORUM, SHALL BE SUBJECT TO A VIOLATION
   20  PUNISHABLE BY A FINE OF NOT  MORE  THAN  FIFTY  DOLLARS  PER  VIOLATION,
   21  RECOVERABLE  IN AN ACTION BY ANY ENFORCEMENT AUTHORITY DESIGNATED BY ANY
   22  MUNICIPALITY OR POLITICAL SUBDIVISION.
   23    5. IT SHALL BE A DEFENSE THAT ANY PERSON, FIRM, CORPORATION,  PARTNER-
   24  SHIP,  ASSOCIATION,  LIMITED  LIABILITY  COMPANY,  OR  OTHER ENTITY THAT

    3  LIMITED  LIABILITY  COMPANY, OR OTHER ENTITY DID NOT HAVE KNOWLEDGE THAT
    4  IT WAS SALVIA DIVINORUM, AND SUCH KNOWLEDGE WAS NOT REASONABLY DISCOVER-
    5  ABLE.
    6    S  2.  This  act  shall take effect on the sixtieth day after it shall
    7  have become a law.
